Body: I am curious what could have caused the shift in pronunciation. I presume it must have occurred after the spelling of words was standardized. According to the History of French wikipedia article, this happened in the transition to Middle French around 1500 and to Early Modern French around 1700.
Title: Why don't the French pronounce consonants at the ends of words?
